#!/usr/bin/env python
"""
Simple script to reproduce the separability matrix issue without full astropy installation.
"""

import sys
import os

# Add the astropy directory to the path so we can import the modules directly
sys.path.insert(0, '/tmp/tmpq_7m_4ya/astropy')

try:
    # Try to import the necessary modules directly
    from astropy.modeling import models as m
    from astropy.modeling.separable import separability_matrix
    
    print("Testing separability matrix issue...")
    
    # Test case 1: Simple compound model (should work)
    print("\n1. Testing simple compound model:")
    cm = m.Linear1D(10) & m.Linear1D(5)
    result1 = separability_matrix(cm)
    print(f"cm = m.Linear1D(10) & m.Linear1D(5)")
    print(f"separability_matrix(cm) = \n{result1}")
    
    # Test case 2: Complex compound model (should work)
    print("\n2. Testing complex compound model:")
    result2 = separability_matrix(m.Pix2Sky_TAN() & m.Linear1D(10) & m.Linear1D(5))
    print(f"separability_matrix(m.Pix2Sky_TAN() & m.Linear1D(10) & m.Linear1D(5)) = \n{result2}")
    
    # Test case 3: Nested compound model (the problematic case)
    print("\n3. Testing nested compound model (problematic case):")
    result3 = separability_matrix(m.Pix2Sky_TAN() & cm)
    print(f"separability_matrix(m.Pix2Sky_TAN() & cm) = \n{result3}")
    
    print("\nIssue reproduction complete!")
    
except ImportError as e:
    print(f"Import error: {e}")
    print("Cannot reproduce issue due to missing dependencies")
    sys.exit(1)
except Exception as e:
    print(f"Error: {e}")
    sys.exit(1)
